intro: Trichocentrum silverarum, commonly known as the silver moon orchid, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking silver-green foliage and pendulous inflorescences that bear clusters of fragrant, white flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are革质 (leathery) and lance-shaped, providing structural support and efficient water retention. Trichocentrum silverarum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and relatively easy care requirements.
